alert.note: Alert for Hocking; Pickaway; Ross (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 11:22PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHWESTERN HOCKING, SOUTHEASTERN PICKAWAY AND EASTERN ROSS COUNTIES THROUGH 1145 PM EDT... At 1121 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near North Folk Village, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, half inch hail, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Chillicothe, Kingston, North Folk Village, Londonderry, Laurelville, Adelphi, Andersonville, Gibisonville, Mooresville, Whisler, South Bloomingville, Richmond Dale, Massieville and Hallsville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
